snippet: The destruction of the Amiriya bomb shelter in Baghdad killed over 400 civilians at the start of an American entanglement in Iraq that has yet to end.
abstract: Baghdad Journal; 25-year anniversary of American bombing of Amiriya bomb shelter in Baghdad, event that killed 408 citizens at outset of Persian Gulf war, passes quietly, pointing to fading significance of symbol once important to Saddam Hussein's anti-American propaganda.

byline.contributor: Falih Hassan and Omar al-Jawoshy contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The destruction of the Amiriya bomb shelter in Baghdad killed over 400 civilians at the start of an American entanglement in Iraq that has yet to end.

headline.print_headline: Scars Left by American Bombs Resist Fading, 25 Years Later
headline.main: After 25 Years of U.S. Role in Iraq, Scars Are Too Stubborn to Fade

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
